intro: Tachiadenus platypterus var. angustialatus, commonly known as the narrow-leaf tachiadenus, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It has a taproot system that allows it to survive in nutrient-poor soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some regions.
